resources.string: Software for managing volume and for reducing electromagnetic waves during calls. \nCopyright (C) 2010 - Cristiano Tagliamonte.
Enable or disable whole Sanity sytem. If disabled, this application won\'t affect during phone calls.
Disable automatic handling of devices and handsfree when headsets (wired or wireless) are connected.
Force bluetooth audio device to be correctly handled by Sanity.
Check this option only if Sanity enable/disable handsfree or devices in a wrong way when the phone is far/close to your ear.
Set default values to all application preferences.
Which devices should be disabled for reducing electromagnetic waves during a call.
Disable GPS during a call (it will be restored at call end). It works with many phone models, but not with all.
Disable Mobile Data (2G/3G) during a call (it will be restored at call end). It works with many phone models, but not with all.
Skip automatic Mobile Data (2G/3G) disabling during a call when GPS is enabled.
Disable Wifi during a call (it will be restored at call end).
Disable Bluetooth during a call (it will be restored at call end).
Skip automatic Bluetooth disabling during a call if there are Bluetooth devices connected to phone.
Skip automatic Mobile Data (2G/3G) and Wifi disabling during a call if phone is configured like Router Wifi.
Skip automatic Mobile Data disabling during a call if Tethering USB is enabled.
Options for enabling and disabling devices during a call by checking proximity sensor.
Turn OFF devices only when the phone is close to your ear. (If disabled, turn off when call start.)
Delay for turning OFF devices when your ear is close to phone.
Turn ON devices (turned off by Sanity) during a call when the phone is NOT close to your ear.
Delay for turning ON devices when the phone is NOT close to your ear.
Force to turn OFF the screen during call when the phone is close to your ear.
Force to turn ON the screen during call when the phone is far from your ear.
Automatically enable/disable handsfree when the phone is far/close to your ear.
Delay for automatically turning ON handsfree when the phone is NOT close to your ear.
Set maximum volume when Sanity automatically enables handsfree.
Options for automatic volume setting during a call.
Volume to automatically set during a call while no headsets are used.
Volume to automatically set during a call while using wired headsets.
Volume to automatically set during a call while using wireless headsets.
Play only the audio of the conversation, muting any other audio stream during phone calls.
Choose when Sanity should show notifications.
Notify when devices are automatically turned off by Sanity.
Notify when devices are automatically restored by Sanity.
Notify if Sanity is running when a phone call starts.
Notify when volume is automatically changed by Sanity.
Information about this application and tools for contacting the developer.
Tap here to write an email to the developer. You can use email also for bug reports and feature requests.
You are invited to leave a comment about Sanity on Market. Tap here to open Market. Please don\'t report bugs in Market comments.
Tap here to open the ufficial web site of the GNU General Public License version 3.
For supporting Sanity, you can donate the money amount you prefer using PayPal. Tap here to open PayPal site.
Sanity is free. If you like this application, support the development with a donation.
You have supported Sanity. Thank you for your donation!
This is the full version of Sanity.
Use administrator privileges for turning off screen when you put the phone close to your ear during a call.

Sanity requires administrator privileges just for turning off the screen during a phone call. Without such privileges, Sanity cannot turn off screen when you put the phone close to your ear during a call. Anyway, disabling administrator is required to uninstall Sanity.

Confirm this request to allow Sanity for turning off the screen during phone calls.\n\REMEMBER to disable \"Administrator\" option in Sanity for uninstalling the application! While Sanity is a device administrator, you cannot uninstall it.
Here is required at least Android version 2.2 (Froyo). Sorry, your phone has Android 2.1 (Eclair).

WARNING: if your bluetooth audio already works well with Sanity, don't activate this option!

This option should be activated only if Sanity doesn't work well with your bluetooth audio.

If this option is activated, Sanity will enable/disable nothing while any bluetooth device is connected.

Are you sure to activate this option to force bluetooth audio?

WARNING: if Sanity already works well on your phone, don't activate this option!

This option should be activated on those phones have a bugged proximity sensor.

Are you sure to activate this option for reversing proximity?

WARNING: this function will restore all default preference values.

All current application preferences will be lost.

Would you really reset all preferences?
Unable to open Market application! Check the Internet connection is properly working and Market is rightly installed.

Thank you for using Sanity.

This is the free version, with full capabilities. If you like Sanity, you can donate for supporting it. When donating, this dialog will be suppressed.

Would you open Market now for donating?

This application is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. 
This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License version 3 for more details, you can find a copy on http://www.gnu.org/licenses/. 
 
Choose "Ok" button to agree this software license. 
Choose "Cancel" button to refuse it.
Show recent changes implemented in the last Sanity versions.

Version 1.4
 - Fix: crash on Android 2.1 (Eclair), but now it works.
 - Fix: minor bugs.
 
Version 1.3
 - New: option to use device administration for turning off the screen (you have to enable "Administrator" option); Android 2.2+ required.
 - Fix: crash during first start when not upgrading.
 - Fix: minor bugs.
 
Version 1.2
 - New: option to skip automatic Wifi and Mobile Data disabling when Hotspot Wifi is enabled.
 - New: option to skip automatic Mobile Data disabling when Tethering USB is enabled.
 
Version 1.1
 - New: option to force turn on screen when phone is far from ear.
 
Version 1.0
 - New: volume option to mute all audio streams except the conversation one (during a call).
 - New: notification option to show automatic volume changes.
 - Fix: delay for turning on handsfree works now.
 - Fix: minor bug for handling automatic volume.
 
Version 0.9
 - New: option for supporting phones have reversed proximity sensor.
 - New: option for supporting unrecognized bluetooth audio devices.
 - Fix: sometimes devices were not automatically restored after ringing without answer.
 - Fix: others minor bugs.
 - Change: minor user interface improvements.
 
Version 0.8
 - Fix: user interface bugs 
Version 0.7
 - New: option to avoid automatic disabling of Mobile Data when GPS is enabled.
 
Version 0.6
 - New: option to automatic enable/disable GPS during phone calls.
 - Change: featured user interface.
 
Version 0.5
 - New: option to avoid automatic bluetooth disabling when there are bluetooth devices connected.
 - New: option to delay automatic handsfree enabler.
 - Fix: more bluetooth audio devices are recognized during phone call.
 - Fix: minor bug caused occasional crashes at call end.
 - New: tools for contacting the developer.
 
Version 0.4
 - Fix: now bluetooth headsets are correctly handled.
 - Change: notify activity only when call starts.
 
Version 0.3
 - New: option to force turn off screen when phone is close to ear.
 
Version 0.2
 - First published release.
